abstract: More Americans say China is the world’s leading economic power than say the United States is. We say: Buck up, Americans!
snippet: More Americans say China is the world’s leading economic power than say the United States is. We say: Buck up, Americans!
lead_paragraph: With China’s President, Hu Jintao, coming to the United States next week, Andrew Kohut of the Pew Research Center reports:

abstract: Arvind Subramanian of the Peterson Institute for International Economics argues that China’s economy is bigger than the American economy.
snippet: Arvind Subramanian of the Peterson Institute for International Economics argues that China’s economy is bigger than the American economy.
lead_paragraph: In my post on China and the United States earlier today, I was careful to say that, by most measures, the United States still has by far the largest economy in the world. The International Monetary Fund, for instance, estimates gross domestic product in the United States to have been about $14.6 trillion last year, while China’s was $10.1 trillion. The World Bank estimates a similar gap.

headline.main: On the Size of China’s Economy, a Dissenter
